intro: Anemopaegma carajasense, commonly known as the Carajás anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
